	Hospitality industry network is a plus.

	Recurring Income: Continue earning commissions from repeat orders of your secured clients.
	Growth Opportunity: Be part of a fast-scaling drinks delivery platform
	Support &amp; Structure: Sales playbooks, marketing support, and operational backing to help you win.

B2B Sales Representative Job at Sippy Life




        
    

        
        Sippy Life is Nigeria’s next-generation drinks delivery and distribution platform, serving both individuals and businesses. We provide lounges, clubs, hotels, restaurants, and everyday customers with quality drinks, competitive pricing, and reliable delivery.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: B2B Sales Representative

Job Location: Abuja (FCT)

About the Role
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Join Sippy Life, Nigeria’s fast-growing drinks platform. As a B2B Sales Agent, you’ll help lounges, clubs, hotels, and restaurants streamline restocking with quality products, competitive pricing, and fast delivery.
	Success in this role means closing deals, building long-term client accounts, and driving repeat business.


Responsibilities


	Prospect, pitch, and close new B2B clients.
	Manage the full sales cycle from first contact to account growth.
	Build and maintain long-term client relationships.
	Consistently meet and exceed sales targets.


Qualifications


	2+ years of proven B2B sales experience.
	Strong negotiation and closing skills.
	Hospitality industry network is a plus.
	Based in Abuja, self-driven and ambitious.


Compensation


	Competitive Pay: Monthly salary plus up to 10% commission on profit from every deal you close.
	Recurring Income: Continue earning commissions from repeat orders of your secured clients.
	Growth Opportunity: Be part of a fast-scaling drinks delivery platform
	Support & Structure: Sales playbooks, marketing support, and operational backing to help you win.

  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Treasury / Accounts Officer",
  "description": "Ikeja Electricity Distribution Company (IKEDC)is one of the largest power distribution companies in Nigeria, committed to delivering reliable and efficient electricity services to our customers. With a strong focus on innovation and sustainability, we aim to

transform the energy landscape in Nigeria and contribute to the country&#39;s economic development. Our mission is to provide exceptional service while ensuring the safety and well being of our employees and customers. At Ikeja Electric, we don&rsquo;t just power homes and businesses we power careers. As a leading energy provider, we are committed to fostering a culture that champions integrity, innovation, and excellence. Our team is the heartbeat of our success, and we thrive on collaboration, continuous improvement, and creating a workplace where everyone can shine.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Treasury / Accounts Officer
Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos

Role Purpose


	To ensure accurate maintenance and recording of financial transactions at the business unit level, supporting effective financial management and reporting.


Role Accountabilities


	Record and maintain supporting documentation for all financial transactions at the business unit/undertaking level.
	Ensure proper documentation and verification of proofs and bills for each financial transaction.
	Post sub-ledger entries and reconcile balances with the general ledger.
	Submit accurate documentation and bills to the Accounts Department to support timely preparation of monthly journal entries and account reconciliations.
	Review and validate claims, including computation of bill amounts and adjustments, to ensure accuracy.
	Prepare monthly revenue reports based on billing records.
	Monitor and track the company&rsquo;s cash flow forecasts to support liquidity management.
	Investigate and reconcile financial discrepancies by collecting and analyzing account information.
	Ensure compliance with the Quality Management System, Occupational Health &amp; Safety requirements, and all applicable regulations.
	Perform any other related duties as assigned by the Financial Accounting &amp; Reporting Specialist or the Finance &amp; Administration Manager.


Minimun Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Finance &amp; Accounts or its equivalent.
	0 - 2 years of relevant experience.


Skills and Competencies:


	Accounting Policies and Transactions.
	Financial Analysis and Planning.
	Management Accounting.
	Customer Centricity.
	Risk Management.
	People Leadership.
	Entrepreneurship.
	Organisational Learning.
	Change Management.

        Ikeja Electricity Distribution Company (IKEDC)is one of the largest power distribution companies in Nigeria, committed to delivering reliable and efficient electricity services to our customers. With a strong focus on innovation and sustainability, we aim to
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



transform the energy landscape in Nigeria and contribute to the country's economic development. Our mission is to provide exceptional service while ensuring the safety and well being of our employees and customers. At Ikeja Electric, we don’t just power homes and businesses we power careers. As a leading energy provider, we are committed to fostering a culture that champions integrity, innovation, and excellence. Our team is the heartbeat of our success, and we thrive on collaboration, continuous improvement, and creating a workplace where everyone can shine.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Treasury / Accounts Officer
Job Location: Lagos

Role Purpose


	To ensure accurate maintenance and recording of financial transactions at the business unit level, supporting effective financial management and reporting.


Role Accountabilities


	Record and maintain supporting documentation for all financial transactions at the business unit/undertaking level.
	Ensure proper documentation and verification of proofs and bills for each financial transaction.
	Post sub-ledger entries and reconcile balances with the general ledger.
	Submit accurate documentation and bills to the Accounts Department to support timely preparation of monthly journal entries and account reconciliations.
	Review and validate claims, including computation of bill amounts and adjustments, to ensure accuracy.
	Prepare monthly revenue reports based on billing records.
	Monitor and track the company’s cash flow forecasts to support liquidity management.
	Investigate and reconcile financial discrepancies by collecting and analyzing account information.
	Ensure compliance with the Quality Management System, Occupational Health & Safety requirements, and all applicable regulations.
	Perform any other related duties as assigned by the Financial Accounting & Reporting Specialist or the Finance & Administration Manager.


Minimun Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Finance & Accounts or its equivalent.
	0 - 2 years of relevant experience.


Skills and Competencies:


	Accounting Policies and Transactions.
	Financial Analysis and Planning.
	Management Accounting.
	Customer Centricity.
	Risk Management.
	People Leadership.
	Entrepreneurship.
	Organisational Learning.
	Change Management.

  "title": "Growth & Operations Manager",
  "description": "Haanta.com is a curated marketplace connecting discerning customers in the US and Canada to the vibrant world of contemporary African fashion and lifestyle. We are more than an e-commerce platform; we are a celebration of culture, a storytelling engine, and a global stage for Africa&#39;s most creative designers. Our mission is to build a brand rooted in authenticity and community, empowering local talent to achieve global reach.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Growth &amp; Operations Manager, Africa

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos, Nigeria
Reports to: Chief Operating Officer (COO)

The Opportunity


	This is more than a job; it&#39;s a chance to be a foundational commercial leader within a high-growth, mission-driven company. We are seeking a dynamic and entrepreneurial Growth &amp; Operations Manager to be our on-the-ground leader in Africa.
	You will be the architect of our entire operational backbone, the primary bridge to our incredible African brand partners, and a key driver of our commercial success.
	This strategic role requires a unique blend of operational prowess, partnership acumen, and a sharp commercial instinct.
	You will not just manage processes; you will build them from the ground up, command influence, and own revenue goals by transforming powerful partnerships into platform growth.


What You&#39;ll Build &amp; Own
Strategic Growth &amp; Commercial Leadership:


	Own key growth metrics, including Gross Merchandise Value (GMV) targets originating from your portfolio of African brand partners.
	Translate Haanta&rsquo;s overarching business goals into a clear, actionable commercial and operational strategy for the continent.
	Work directly with the C-suite to model and forecast growth, identifying opportunities and risks to revenue targets.
	Leverage your network and market insights to identify new opportunities for high-impact partnerships, collaborations, and business development that drive sales.


Commercial Partnerships &amp; Vendor Growth:


	Co-lead the full partnership lifecycle: from sourcing and vetting high-potential African brands to negotiating commercial terms (e.g., commissions, exclusivity, marketing commitments) and overseeing a seamless onboarding process.
	Act as the relationship owner for our community of designers, driving their success on the platform as the key to unlocking our collective revenue goals.
	Co-develop and execute sales strategies with our marketing team, leveraging unique vendor stories and exclusive collections to drive customer acquisition and revenue.
	Activate brand partners to participate in key marketing campaigns, promotions, and collection launches, ensuring alignment between supply-side exclusivity and demand-side excitement.


Operational Excellence &amp; Scalable Systems:


	Architect and execute the end-to-end operational roadmap, designing scalable processes for order management, fulfillment, and international logistics that support our growth targets.
	Own the entire supply chain, from the moment a customer places an order to its final delivery in the US or Canada, ensuring a premium customer experience that drives loyalty and repeat purchases.
	Select, manage, and hold accountable key logistics partners (3PLs, carriers) to optimize for speed, cost, and reliability.
	Establish and relentlessly track operational KPIs, understanding their direct impact on profitability and customer satisfaction.


Who We&#39;re Looking For


	A Commercially-Minded Strategist: You don&#39;t just see partnerships; you see revenue opportunities. You naturally connect the dots between brand onboarding, marketing narratives, and sales outcomes.
	An Influential Communicator &amp; Negotiator: You excel at building consensus and are a skilled negotiator, comfortable structuring and closing deals that create mutual value for Haanta and our brand partners.
	A Proven Growth Leader: You have 5+ years of hands-on experience in a role with direct P&amp;L or revenue responsibility, such as business development, category management, operations, or partnerships, ideally within an e-commerce or marketplace environment.
	An Entrepreneurial Mindset: You are a strategic thinker who can also roll up their sleeves and execute. You thrive in ambiguity, take ownership, and are motivated by ambitious targets.
	A Natural Connector: You have a deep, influential network within the Nigerian/African business, fashion, or tech ecosystem. You build relationships with ease and are respected by your peers.
	Data-Driven: You are comfortable with sales data, operational metrics, and logistics software. You use data to identify growth levers and make informed decisions.


Preferred Qualifications:


	Strong Negotiation Skills
	Deep experience in the Fashion Industry in Nigeria and Africa
	Experience managing logistics operations - intra-country and internationally
	Well established network within the Fashion Industry in Nigeria and Africa
	A deeply motivated self starter &amp; problem solver.


Why Join Haanta?


	This is your chance to be more than an employee; it&#39;s an opportunity to be a builder. You will be at the heart of a business shaping the future of global fashion, creating tangible economic impact for African creators, and writing the playbook for a new generation of culturally-rich marketplaces.
	If you are driven by mission, ownership, and the challenge of building from the ground up, this is the role for you.


What We Offer


	Competitive Salary &amp; Meaningful Equity: A strong compensation package including a significant equity stake as a foundational member of the team.
	Performance-Based Bonuses: You will be eligible for significant sales bonuses tied directly to achieving and exceeding Gross Merchandise Value (GMV) targets. We believe in rewarding those who drive our growth.
	Autonomy &amp; Ownership: We are hiring you to own a critical part of our business. You will be given the trust and autonomy to build, lead, and drive results.
	A Pivotal Role in a Global Mission: A front-row seat to building a category-defining company that is amplifying African creativity on the world stage.

Operational Excellence & Scalable Systems:


	Architect and execute the end-to-end operational roadmap, designing scalable processes for order management, fulfillment, and international logistics that support our growth targets.
	Own the entire supply chain, from the moment a customer places an order to its final delivery in the US or Canada, ensuring a premium customer experience that drives loyalty and repeat purchases.

	Establish and relentlessly track operational KPIs, understanding their direct impact on profitability and customer satisfaction.

	A Commercially-Minded Strategist: You don't just see partnerships; you see revenue opportunities. You naturally connect the dots between brand onboarding, marketing narratives, and sales outcomes.
	An Influential Communicator & Negotiator: You excel at building consensus and are a skilled negotiator, comfortable structuring and closing deals that create mutual value for Haanta and our brand partners.
	A Proven Growth Leader: You have 5+ years of hands-on experience in a role with direct P&L or revenue responsibility, such as business development, category management, operations, or partnerships, ideally within an e-commerce or marketplace environment.

	A Natural Connector: You have a deep, influential network within the Nigerian/African business, fashion, or tech ecosystem. You build relationships with ease and are respected by your peers.
	Data-Driven: You are comfortable with sales data, operational metrics, and logistics software. You use data to identify growth levers and make informed decisions.

	Strong Negotiation Skills
	Deep experience in the Fashion Industry in Nigeria and Africa
	Experience managing logistics operations - intra-country and internationally
	Well established network within the Fashion Industry in Nigeria and Africa
	A deeply motivated self starter & problem solver.

	This is your chance to be more than an employee; it's an opportunity to be a builder. You will be at the heart of a business shaping the future of global fashion, creating tangible economic impact for African creators, and writing the playbook for a new generation of culturally-rich marketplaces.
